Subsection (c)(3)(C) of this Section Prior to RepealPrior to repeal by section 13305(a) of Pub. L. 115–97, subsection (c)(3)(C) of this section read as follows: (c) Qualified production activities income (3) Special rules for determining costs (C) Transportation costs of independent refiners (i) In general In the case of any taxpayer who is in the trade or business of refining crude oil and who is not a major integrated oil company (as defined in section 167(h)(5)(B), determined without regard to clause (iii) thereof) for the taxable year, in computing oil related qualified production activities income under subsection (d)(9)(B), the amount allocated to domestic production gross receipts under paragraph (1)(B) for costs related to the transportation of oil shall be 25 percent of the amount properly allocable under such paragraph (determined without regard to this subparagraph).
